required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: β-RELIEVED - REsponse in Acute fLare and In prEVEntion of episoDes of Re-flare in Gout - Extension 3 (E3)
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label Extension Study of CACZ885H2356E2 and CACZ885H2357E2 on the Treatment and Prevention of Gout Flares in Patients With Frequent Flares for Whom NSAIDs and/or Colchicine Are Contraindicated, Not Tolerated or Ineffective

brief_summary.textblock: This was an 18-month, multi-center, open-label, clinical extension study. Patients completing earlier second extension studies (CACZ885H2356E2 and CACZ885H2357E2) continued to be treated in this combined extension 3 study for any new gouty arthritis flare on demand with one subcutaneous (s.c.) injection of canakinumab 150 mg.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Incidence Rate (IR) of Adverse Events, Serious Adverse Events and Death Per 100 Patient-years in Participants
primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of the core studies (CACZ885H2357 [NCT01080131] and CACZ885H2361 [NCT01356602]) up to end of the current study (36 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events (AEs) were defined as any unfavorable and unintended diagnosis, symptom, sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), syndrome or disease which either occurs during study, having been absent at baseline,or, if present at baseline, appears to worsen. Serious adverse events (SAEs) were defined as any untoward medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require (or prolong) hospitalization, cause persistent or significant disability/incapacity, result in congenital anomalies or birth defects, or are other conditions which in judgement of investigators represent significant hazards.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of New Flares Per Participant
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of the core studies (CACZ885H2357 [NCT01080131] and CACZ885H2361 [NCT01356602]) up to end of the current study (36 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Flare rate was calculated as the number of new flares over the period of observation in years. New flares occurred before first study medication dose in extension 3 study were considered.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient's Assessment of Gout Pain Intensity in the Most Affected Joint
secondary_outcome.description: Participant scored their current pain intensity in the most affected joint of the gout flare on a 5-point Likert Scale (none or mild).

intervention.description: canakinumab 150 mg s.c., given on demand upon new flares

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have completed the second extension studies CACZ885H2356E2 or CACZ885H2357E2
- Patients treated with canakinumab in the core studies or subsequent extensions
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or nursing (lactating) women

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This study was conducted at 60 centers from 10-November-2011 (first participant first visit) to 22-May-2013 (last participant last visit).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 456 participants were randomized in the core studies (CACZ885H2356 and CACZ885H2357) of which 335 participants entered the first extension (CACZ885H2356E2) study. Out of the 317 participants who completed the first extension studies, 272 participants entered the second extension studies(CACZ885H2357E2 ). Out of the 249 participants who completed the second extension studies 136 participants entered the third extension study(CACZ885H2357E3).

group.title: Canakinumab 150 mg
group.description: Participants received 150 mg subcutaneously (S.C) at randomization and upon new flare. The doses were provided as pre-filled syringes.

group.title: Triamcinolone Acetonide 40 mg
group.description: Participants received 40 mg intramuscular (IM) at randomization and upon new flare.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Participants did not entered extension studies 1, 2 and 3

baseline.population: The Safety Set consists of all participants that received study drug in the core study and had at least one post-baseline safety assessment. The demographic data was not combined for the E3 analysis.

group.title: Canakinumab 150 mg
group.description: Participants received 150 mg subcutaneously (S.C) at randomization and upon new flare. The doses were provided as pre-filled syringes.

group.title: Triamcinolone Acetonide 40 mg
group.description: Participants received 40 mg Triamcinolone Acetonide intramuscular (IM) at randomization and upon new flare and re-treated with at least 1 dose of canakinumab.

Serious adverse events (SAEs) were defined as any untoward medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require (or prolong) hospitalization, cause persistent or significant disability/incapacity, result in congenital anomalies or birth defects, or are other conditions which in judgement of investigators represent significant hazards.

Serious adverse events (SAEs) were defined as any untoward medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require (or prolong) hospitalization, cause persistent or significant disability/incapacity, result in congenital anomalies or birth defects, or are other conditions which in judgement of investigators represent significant hazards.

outcome.title: Number of New Flares Per Participant
outcome.description: Flare rate was calculated as the number of new flares over the period of observation in years. New flares occurred before first study medication dose in extension 3 study were considered.
outcome.time_frame: From start of the core studies (CACZ885H2357 [NCT01080131] and CACZ885H2361 [NCT01356602]) up to end of the current study (36 weeks)
outcome.population: Modified Analysis Set (MAS) consisted of all participants randomized in the core studies and received both treatments according to their exposure.

group.title: Canakinumab 150 mg
group.description: Participants received 150 mg subcutaneously (S.C) at randomization and upon new flare. The doses were provided as pre-filled syringes.

measure.title: Number of New Flares Per Participant
measure.description: Flare rate was calculated as the number of new flares over the period of observation in years. New flares occurred before first study medication dose in extension 3 study were considered.
measure.population: Modified Analysis Set (MAS) consisted of all participants randomized in the core studies and received both treatments according to their exposure.

outcome.title: Patient's Assessment of Gout Pain Intensity in the Most Affected Joint
outcome.description: Participant scored their current pain intensity in the most affected joint of the gout flare on a 5-point Likert Scale (none or mild).
outcome.population: Modified Analysis Set (MAS) consisted of all Full Analysis Set (FAS) participants. The FAS consisted of all enrolled participants who have received at least one dose of study medication. This outcome measure was assessed only in the subset of participants who had re-treatment with at least one dose of canakinumab.

group.title: Canakinumab Retreatment
group.description: Participants received 150 mg canakinumab subcutaneously (S.C) at randomization and upon new flare and re-treated with at least 1 dose of canakinumab.

group.title: Triamcinolone Acetonide- Randomized to Canakinumab Treatment
group.description: Participants received 40 mg Triamcinolone Acetonide intramuscular (IM) at randomization and upon new flare and re-treated with at least 1 dose of canakinumab.

measure.title: Patient's Assessment of Gout Pain Intensity in the Most Affected Joint
measure.description: Participant scored their current pain intensity in the most affected joint of the gout flare on a 5-point Likert Scale (none or mild).
measure.population: Modified Analysis Set (MAS) consisted of all Full Analysis Set (FAS) participants. The FAS consisted of all enrolled participants who have received at least one dose of study medication. This outcome measure was assessed only in the subset of participants who had re-treatment with at least one dose of canakinumab.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
